item.title: Avalanche Q&A with Wildlife Studios - Expanding into Web3 Gaming
item.description: Speaker(s): @avalancheavax, @EdC, @NFT_Silent, @0xJ010 Held on: 16-03-2022 Written on: 16-03-2022 URL: https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1OdKrBgeddqKX Background Wildlife Studios 10 years company based in Brazil 2 billion mobile downloads across apps Top 10 mobile developer Castle Crush

item.title: Avalanche QnA with Chikn - Farmland and the New Era of NFTs
item.description: Speaker(s): @avalancheavax, @chikn_nft, @EdC, @SaltLampDAO Held on: 11-03-2022 Written on: 14-03-2022 URL: https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1DXGyDVDywVKM Why Avalanche? Other layer 2s don’t have that community that Avalanche has(yet) Potential of ERC721 and being able to constantly interact with NFTs Chikn as an idea Chikn kickstarted after seeing some generative art Inspired by Rarity Manifested and Wolf Game tried to improve on their tokenomics and engineer better supply and demand tried to let it grow organically, as a result community is more invested in vision Farmland Farmland touted to be first gamified LP farm Other tokens LP will be added in the future, probably 3rd party NFT tokens Airdrops are likely but still a secret.

item.title: Avalanche Summit 2022 - Building for a Multi-Chain Future
item.description: Speaker(s): Stani Kulechov Held on: 23-03-2022 Written on: 23-03-2022 Aave V3 Aave Capital Efficiency Risk and security Enhanced decentralization Portals Cross-chain transactions to flow seamlessly Whitelisted bridge protocols to mint and burn a capped amount of tokens Governance can whitelist protocols Efficiency Mode Capital efficiency Increased borrowing power For assets highly correlated (AVAX-sAVAX, USDC-DAI).

item.description: Speaker(s): Christine Lee, Anand Gomes (not present), Darius Sit, Joshua Lim Held on: 21-03-2022 Written on: 21-03-2022 Ribbon Finance

item.description: Speaker(s): Fanfaron Held on: 22-03-2022 Written on: 22-03-2022 Problems with the metaverse Ragnarok on Avalanche Play2Earn games = Click to earn.

item.title: Avalanche Summit 2022 - Game-Changing Trends
item.description: Speaker(s): Marc Zeller, Grace Kwan, Eric Chen, Omer Demirel, Andrew Durgee Held on: 21-03-2022 Written on: 21-03-2022 Every Layer 1 are probably going to have a form of Layer 2 framework

item.title: Avalanche Summit 2022 - Gaming Reveal - Ascenders
item.description: Speaker(s): Jackson Poon Held on: 21-03-2022 Written on: 21-03-2022 Background Ascenders on Avalanche inspired by zelda botw2, lego Classes Fighter - combat forward, for hardcore players Explorer - map discovery and explore overworld, for casual players Builder - collect nfts Team - Jackson Poon (CEO), Will Davis, Chris Rothwell Economy No ponzinomics lol Blacksmith has to craft items.

item.title: Avalanche Summit 2022 - Gaming Reveal - Crabada
item.description: Speaker(s): KH Chan Held on: 21-03-2022 Written on: 21-03-2022 Background Crabada Idle Game NFTs gets you $CRA and $TUS 5000 daily active users 20mil + daily volume 20% of Avalanche C-chain transactions Battle Game [[Crabada Battle Game]] Mid to end april real time PvP and PvE (feels like Axie Infinity) Crafting based economy Crabs improve and maximize using a in-game currency (shells).

item.title: Avalanche Summit 2022 - Gaming Reveal - Wildlife Studios
item.description: Speaker(s): Fernando Sette Held on: 21-03-2022 Written on: 21-03-2022 Background Vision - attract and develop the most amazing game designers Plan to invest >200mil to make Wildlife Studios the go-to place for best game designers Blockchain allows for different social dynamics between players and dev Assets in one game has value in another game.

item.title: Avalanche Summit 2022 - How Should Founders Look at VCs
item.description: Speaker(s): Joon Ian Wong, Travis Scher, Amos Meiri, Peter Najarian , Jeffrey Amico Held on: 21-03-2022 Written on: 21-03-2022 On Venture capitalists and founders Venture Capitalist in web2 and web3 not that different give guidance, capital which founders needs when tech has matured, then it might be different naive to believe that web3 companies can mature without expertise of VCs founders do want the help Difference: hyper competitive Founders need to decide if they want the capital or the help Having a warchest and help (half rugged) communication takes place much openly on twitter uhh they rugged the livestream

item.title: Avalanche Summit 2022 - LayerZero
item.description: Speaker(s): Ryan Zarick Held on: 22-03-2022 Written on: 22-03-2022 Connecting Avalanche Subnets LayerZero on Avalanche Subnets Most devs use their own bridge for value transfer LayerZero allows for the same game to be played across chains.

item.title: Avalanche Summit 2022 - The Chikn and the Egg
item.description: Speaker(s): Michael ‘Booksy’ Books Held on: 23-03-2022 Written on: 23-03-2022 Upgradeable NFTs Upgradable NFT ERC721 contract that can be altered with specific on-chain actions Make ‘normal’ NFT obsolete Chikn wants to make this process of upgradability accessible to everyone Shows demo on how to buy a Chikn, and feed it using $FEED Makes comparisons on fees and tx speed on Avalanche and Ethereum

item.title: Avalanche Summit 2022 - The Perfect Mint - Smart contract, Metadata, and IPFS – what's the best and most secure formula
item.description: Speaker(s): Ori Levi, Shahaf Antwarg, Harrison Seletsky Held on: 22-03-2022 Written on: 22-03-2022 Current Problems with the NFT Landscape There is a right way to launch NFTs Mistakes result in lost value Some exchanges take your NFT and put it in their contract.

item.title: Avalanche Summit 2022 - The Year of Gaming Subnets
item.description: Speaker(s): Edward Chang, Calvin Zhou, KH Chan, Faun Held on: 22-03-2022 Written on: 22-03-2022 Why Subnets Ability to use other gas tokens avalab toolings are extremely good and easy to use Personal application chain An application can have multiple chains with different virtual machines DeFi Kingdoms says they like to be able explore non-evm chains Open up interesting opportunities like Liquid Staking on Subnet - Faun hopes to see Subnets for applications explode Validators DeFi Kingdoms validators

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Obsidian I recommend using Obsidian as a way to edit and grow your digital garden.

item.title: Lifetime Value
item.description: A prediction of the profit margin a game developer will earn from an average user during the entire time they play the game

item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) Strengthening Online Social Bonds: Research Garden Jacky Zhao’s Garden Anson Yu’s Garden Shihyu’s PKM Chloe’s Garden SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory Brandon Boswell’s Garden If you want to see your own on here, submit a Pull Request adding yourself to this file!

item.title: Valid Delivery
item.description: Definition Formulated in Layer Zero Whitepaper Every message m sent over the network is coupled with a transaction t on the sender-side chain.
